maml:description.maml:para: Add new HTTP header to collection
Add new HTTP header to collection
The name of new HTTP header
The value of new HTTP header
The name of new HTTP header
The value of new HTTP header

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create new HTTP header's collection and add new HTTP header 'x-amz-custom' with value 'custom'

maml:description.maml:para: Set HTTP header for specified item(s)
Set HTTP header for specified item(s)
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code:
$s3 = Get-CloudS3Connection -Key $key -Secret $secret $bucket = $s3 | Select-CloudFolder -Path $bucketname $item = $bucket | Get-CloudItem $itemname
$headers = New-CloudHeaders x-amz-custom custom
$item | Add-CloudItemHeaders -Headers $headers

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set custom HTTP header for specified item

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code:
$s3 = Get-CloudS3Connection -Key $key -Secret $secret $bucket = $s3 | Select-CloudFolder -Path $bucketname $folder = $bucket | Get-CloudItem $foldername
$headers = New-CloudHeaders x-amz-custom custom
$folder | Add-CloudItemHeaders -Filter *.txt -Headers $headers

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set custom HTTP header for all text files in specified folder

maml:description.maml:para: Set new permissions for cloud item.
Command adds permission to user or group. If user is not in the ACL, user entry will be added.
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.
Grant full control permission. This means that all other permission will be granted.
Apply for all subfolders and files
Grant full control permission. This means that all other permission will be granted.
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.
Grant full control permission. This means that all other permission will be granted.
Apply for all subfolders and files

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set read access for All Users for folder and all childs (subfolders and files)

maml:description.maml:para: Copy cloud item (file or folder) to the Destination
Copy cloud item (file or folder) to the Destination
Storage class (it can be rrs or standard)
Use Server Side Encryption (valid only for Amazon S3)
Storage class (it can be rrs or standard)
Use Server Side Encryption (valid only for Amazon S3)
Sync cloud items from the Source to the Destination or bidirectional
Sync cloud items from the Source to the Destination or bidirectional
Specify direction of synchronization. Unidirectional if not set.
Delete files from the target if they no longer exist on source
If the option is off only files in this directory will be included in synchronization otherwise all subfolders will be included
Use MD5 hash to compare content of files. This feature is available in PRO version only.
Copy only missing files. Do not update existing files if date modified on target is older than on source
Storage class (it can be rrs or standard)
You can enter one or more file specifications using the standard * and ? wild cards (for example: *.exe; *.dll; d*t.doc; *.t?t) to specify files for sync
You can enter one or more file specifications using the standard * and ? wild cards (for example: *.exe; *.dll; d*t.doc; *.t?t) to specify exclude files
Specify folders to skip. You can use standard * and ? wild cards (for example: bin; *temp*; My*)
Specify direction of synchronization. Unidirectional if not set.
Delete files from the target if they no longer exist on source
If the option is off only files in this directory will be included in synchronization otherwise all subfolders will be included
Use MD5 hash to compare content of files. This feature is available in PRO version only.
Copy only missing files. Do not update existing files if date modified on target is older than on source
Storage class (it can be rrs or standard)
You can enter one or more file specifications using the standard * and ? wild cards (for example: *.exe; *.dll; d*t.doc; *.t?t) to specify files for sync
You can enter one or more file specifications using the standard * and ? wild cards (for example: *.exe; *.dll; d*t.doc; *.t?t) to specify exclude files
Specify folders to skip. You can use standard * and ? wild cards (for example: bin; *temp*; My*)

maml:description.maml:para: Get connection to Amazon S3 service.
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.
Web url type (HTTP, HTTPS, RTMP or HTML)
Private CloudFront distribution policy to generate signed URL
HTML template for generation of code for player (for CloudFront Streaming Distribution only)
Use CloudFront domain name instead of CName
Cloud item, it can be bucket, s3 folder or s3 file.
Web url type (HTTP, HTTPS, RTMP or HTML)
Private CloudFront distribution policy to generate signed URL
HTML template for generation of code for player (for CloudFront Streaming Distribution only)
Use CloudFront domain name instead of CName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generate signed url for CloudFront Distribution item

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code:
$s3 = Get-CloudS3Connection -Key $key -Secret $secret $bucket = $s3 | Select-CloudFolder -Path $bucketname $folder = $bucket | Get-CloudItem $foldername
$folder | Get-CloudUrl -Filter *.jpeg -Type https -CName images.cloudberrylab.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generate web URLs for all jpeg files in specified folder
